channel.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
channel.description:
[center][img]http://sg-forum.info/images/bluefox/misc/logo.gif[/img][/center]
So for the past year I've really been into php/mysql coding. So about a year ago I started this and after about a week I had a pretty good system. Lately i've been adding onto it though. Hopefully some people will have some suggestions on to make the page better. I finished this 2 Christmas' ago (xmas of 2011). Just started messing with it again the past few days. Added item graphing, previous queue data, tag cloud, and more. This was all written from scratch. (resources from google such as tag cloud layout + graph system)
[b]See here:[/b] [u][i]http://playsilab.com/ge/[/i][/u]
[size=7pt][i]dev started: Dec 20, 2011 (ended jan 1, 2012) (continued feb 6, 2013)[/i][/size]
[b][i][u]Features[/u][/i][/b] [code] [i][b]For everyone[/b][/i] > Item Searching > Most expensive items on homepage > 5 Random Items on homepage > Item price data graphing > Commonly searched terms on homepage > Etc [i][b]For moderator ranks[/b][/i] > Mod Panel --Ability to submit changes for items --Ability to add new items to database [i][b]For administrator ranks[/b][/i] >Queue Panel --Ability to view and accept/decline pending item changes [/code]
[u][i][b]Media[/b][/i][/u]
Homepage (top) [img]http://i.imgur.com/Pd6i5R5.png[/img]
Homepage (bottom) [img]http://img252.imageshack.us/img252/5778/de6029866b7b4efb8641b0b.png[/img]
Search Results [img]http://i.imgur.com/rObaLNL.png[/img]
Item Viewing (with graphs) [img]http://i.imgur.com/VAasx36.png[/img]
Mod Panel (top) [img]http://i.imgur.com/YUBYLnJ.png[/img]
Mod Panel (bottom) [img]http://i.imgur.com/MG79ExK.png[/img]
Mod Panel (edit existing menu) [img]http://i.imgur.com/19laO9V.png[/img]
Queue Panel (owner rank) [img]http://img542.imageshack.us/img542/4631/c0a4f2a28c8c42568295547.png[/img]
Any questions? Let me know

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Just assign the table an id, and refer to each item in the CSS as #tableid a
Or use more reusable code and choose a class instead :).

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

That tag cloud is dreadful, please, instead of all this:

<a style="font-size: 11px" class="tag_cloud" target="_blank" href="http://playsilab.com/ge/search.php?search=(g)" title="'(g)' returned a count of 22">(g)</a>

Just assign the table an id, and refer to each item in the CSS as #tableid a, that’s the repeated class names out, you can also kill that inline font size attribute, as well as the target attribute, as they are widely frowned upon. And use relative hrefs!

Not going to even comment on all the break tags brings tears to my eyes

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“silabgarza, post:8, topic:483002”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=601235.msg4218850#msg4218850 date=1360605471]
I’m not trying to sound like a vagina or stuff, but what did you actually want us to do by you posting this here? It’s the PHP system you’re mainly showing off but you haven’t shown us any backend PHP code. We can’t really judge anything without that :o. I’m not trying to get you to release it or stuff but I just don’t see what’s going to be achieved without it lol :P.
[/quote] it’s a show-off i guess, was looking for suggestions as in new content for the site to make it more appealing
and sorry i don’t really plan on giving out any of the php[/quote]
That’s fine I suppose, there just isn’t really much I can do in the improvements back-end. If you added some custom styling rather than just a simple table it would probably improve the design aspect and I honestly think that tag cloud should be removed, it doesn’t compliment that format and colour-scheme at all.

Also since there was already an XSS hole if you weren’t using PDO I’d double check for SQL injections and other common types of hacking.

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:7, topic:483002”]I’m not trying to sound like a vagina or stuff, but what did you actually want us to do by you posting this here? It’s the PHP system you’re mainly showing off but you haven’t shown us any backend PHP code. We can’t really judge anything without that :o. I’m not trying to get you to release it or stuff but I just don’t see what’s going to be achieved without it lol :P.[/quote] it’s a show-off i guess, was looking for suggestions as in new content for the site to make it more appealing
and sorry i don’t really plan on giving out any of the php

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I’m not trying to sound like a cunt or stuff, but what did you actually want us to do by you posting this here? It’s the PHP system you’re mainly showing off but you haven’t shown us any backend PHP code. We can’t really judge anything without that :o. I’m not trying to get you to release it or stuff but I just don’t see what’s going to be achieved without it lol :P.

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[quote=“oldschool-scape, post:4, topic:483002”]Omg!

I’m almost afraid to ask…
but
Are you ever going to release this??? :E

This is epic! exactly what i need for my server![/quote]
sorry no, i’ve considered selling it but don’t think i’d do that either

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:5, topic:483002”]http://playsilab.com/ge/search.php?search=<xmp>

en.wikipedia.org

Cross-site scripting

Cross-site scripting (XSS) is a type of computer security vulnerability typically found in web applications. XSS enables attackers to inject client-side scripts into web pages viewed by other users. A cross-site scripting vulnerability may be used by attackers to bypass access controls such as the same-origin policy. Cross-site scripting carried out on websites accounted for roughly 84% of all security vulnerabilities documented by Symantec as of 2007. Bug bounty company HackerOne in 2017 repo

Frontend code doesn’t look too good. Seeing a lot of tags being misused and tags that shouldn’t be used at all. Run your code through a validator and it’ll probably find more than we can.[/quote]
thank you for pointing that out, i’ve fixed the issue at hand by removing all symbols from the searched term, let me know if this isn’t what you’re talking about ._.

what tags are you saying shouldn’t be used? and alright i’ll run it through a validator. thanks for letting me know about the exploit (if it was one)

Read full topic

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

http://playsilab.com/ge/search.php?search=<xmp>

en.wikipedia.org

Cross-site scripting

Cross-site scripting (XSS) is a type of computer security vulnerability typically found in web applications. XSS enables attackers to inject client-side scripts into web pages viewed by other users. A cross-site scripting vulnerability may be used by attackers to bypass access controls such as the same-origin policy. Cross-site scripting carried out on websites accounted for roughly 84% of all security vulnerabilities documented by Symantec as of 2007. Bug bounty company HackerOne in 2017 repo

Frontend code doesn’t look too good. Seeing a lot of tags being misused and tags that shouldn’t be used at all. Run your code through a validator and it’ll probably find more than we can.

Read full topic

I’m almost afraid to ask…

item.title: [Show-Off] Advanced Price Checker
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

[center][/center]

So for the past year I’ve really been into php/mysql coding. So about a year ago I started this and after about a week I had a pretty good system. Lately i’ve been adding onto it though. Hopefully some people will have some suggestions on to make the page better. I finished this 2 Christmas’ ago (xmas of 2011). Just started messing with it again the past few days. Added item graphing, previous queue data, tag cloud, and more. This was all written from scratch. (resources from google such as tag cloud layout + graph system)

See here: http://playsilab.com/ge/

[size=7pt]dev started: Dec 20, 2011 (ended jan 1, 2012) (continued feb 6, 2013)[/size]

Features

[i][b]For everyone[/b][/i]
> Item Searching
> Most expensive items on homepage
> 5 Random Items on homepage
> Item price data graphing
> Commonly searched terms on homepage
> Etc
[i][b]For moderator ranks[/b][/i]
> Mod Panel
--Ability to submit changes for items
--Ability to add new items to database
[i][b]For administrator ranks[/b][/i]
>Queue Panel
--Ability to view and accept/decline pending item changes
